description: `Relationships` define the genealogy between one or more `Components` interconnected `Components`. Just as in familial relationships, MeshModel `Relationships` are represented in a variety of forms very much resembling familiar ancestral lineage, including `hierarchical` relationships such as direct parent and child relationship as well as any number of layers of indirect grandparent and grandchild relationships. Peer relationships like that of `sibling`s take on different types such as `network` and `dependency`.  Each type of `Relationship` has `metadata`, `selectors` and some optional parameters.

metadata.description: Metadata contains additional information associated with the Relationship.

subType.description: Used for further classification of Relationships. Type and SubType together identifies a Relationship.

selectors.description: Optional selectors used to match Components. Absence of a selector means that it is applied to all Components.

mutatorRef.description: JSON ref to value from where patch should be applied.

items.description: Optional fields that are a part of the `from` selector. Absence of a field has an implied * meaning.

mutatedRef.description: JSON ref to value that should be patched.

items.description: Optional fields that are a part of the `to` selector. Absence of a field has an implied * meaning.
